thread.title: Upper East Side 'Spitting Lady' Arrested Thursday Morning, Police Say
thread.title_full: Upper East Side 'Spitting Lady' Arrested Thursday Morning, Police Say

title: Upper East Side 'Spitting Lady' Arrested Thursday Morning, Police Say
text:
View Full Caption Facebook/Spitting Lady of the Upper East Side: Forum for Spottings 
MANHATTAN — The notorious Upper East Side “spitting lady” was arrested early Thursday morning after hawking on a child three separate times since June, according to police 
Hilda Barrionuevo, 65, was picked up at 4:35 a.m. in front of 328 E. 78th St. and charged with acting in a way that is injurious to a child and stalking, an NYPD spokesman said. 
Her son, Gabriel Uno, 44, was arrested along with Barrionuevo for throwing a table at someone and repeatedly yelled, “Get the f--k out of here!” on March 18, according to police. 
He was charged with menacing, reckless endangerment and criminal possession of a weapon. 
Uno has several prior arrests for grand larceny and criminal possession of stolen property. 
Barrionuevo spat at the child in June, December and January, the NYPD spokesman added. 
Hundreds of Upper East Siders signed a petition demanding local leaders and Mayor Bill de Blasio do something about the woman . 
"This woman is not only a nuisance, but she is a threat as she is assaulting people vilely with saliva," the petition reads. "She mainly spits on children, while also hissing and yelling at them. The community is tired of nothing being done." 
Residents also started a Facebook page that kept tabs on her location so people could try to avoid her. 
Barrionuevo had $19,122 in cash when she was arrested, the New York Post reported. Police could not confirm that information. 
The mother and son were expected to be arraigned in Manhattan Criminal Court either Thursday night or Friday morning.
